docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. officials feel confident enough of a deal that they have notified Congress that they expect the meeting among negotiators in late July will be the last.

headline.main: Pacific Trade Deal Negotiators See a Wrap in Late July
headline.print_headline: Trade Deal Negotiators See a Wrap in Late July

docs.abstract: Negotiators from 12 nations involved in Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement schedule final round of talks for end of July; number of conflicts still remain to be resolved, but United States negotiators appear confident accord can be reached, although ratification of treaty by US Congress cannot occur before end of October.
docs.snippet: U.S. officials feel confident enough of a deal that they have notified Congress that they expect the meeting among negotiators in late July will be the last.

docs.lead_paragraph: Start-ups and doctors are in zealous pursuit of new and sometimes controversial ways to prevent, detect and treat concussions.

headline.main: Effective Concussion Treatment Remains Frustratingly Elusive, Despite a Booming Industry

docs.abstract: Burgeoning industry has grown around concussions, with entrepreneurs, research institutions and medical experts searching for ways to detect, prevent and treat brain injuries; some 1.7 million people annually in United States are treated for concussions, with small percentage of them struggling to recover for year or even longer.
docs.snippet: Start-ups and doctors are in zealous pursuit of new and sometimes controversial ways to prevent, detect and treat concussions.

byline.original: By BARRY MEIER and DANIELLE IVORY

docs.lead_paragraph: The companies say new customers under the Affordable Care Act have been sicker than expected, while federal officials say they want the requests scaled back.

headline.main: Health Insurance Companies Seek Big Rate Increases for 2016
headline.print_headline: Insurers Seek Steep Increases in Plans’ Rates

docs.abstract: Heath insurance companies around United States are seeking rate increases between 20 and 40 percent, alleging their customers under Affordable Care Act are sicker than expected; federal officials say they intend to scale back requests, which threaten to put health insurance out of reach of many.
docs.snippet: The companies say new customers under the Affordable Care Act have been sicker than expected, while federal officials say they want the requests scaled back.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than a third of the U.S. population has health coverage through an insurer that either wants to make a huge acquisition or is about to be swallowed up in one.

headline.main: Insurer Merger Mania Paints Muddied Picture for Consumers
headline.print_headline: Insurer Merger Mania Paints Muddied Picture for Consumers

docs.snippet: More than a third of the U.S. population has health coverage through an insurer that either wants to make a huge acquisition or is about to be swallowed up in one.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials have approved a new combination drug for the most common form of cystic fibrosis, the debilitating inherited disease that causes internal mucus buildup, lung infections and early death. But it will come at a steep price — more than $250,000 for a year's treatment.

headline.main: FDA Clears Drug for Leading Form of Cystic Fibrosis
headline.print_headline: FDA Clears Drug for Leading Form of Cystic Fibrosis

docs.snippet: Federal health officials have approved a new combination drug for the most common form of cystic fibrosis, the debilitating inherited disease that causes internal mucus buildup, lung infections and early death. But it will come at a steep price...
